short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Show humans.txt for the current website, if it exists (see http://humanstxt.org). Based on Humans.txt for Chrome

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
This is a port of Michael Mahemoffâ€™s Chrome extension Humans.txt (https://github.com/mahemoff/humanstxt) to the new Firefox-compatible WebExtension format, with a couple of improvements.

> Humans.txt (http://humanstxt.org) is an initiative for knowing the people behind a website. It's a TXT file that contains information about the different people who have contributed to building the website.

The extension displays an icon in the toolbar when the domain for the website loaded in the active tab hosts a `humans.txt` file. Try it on https://google.com or https://flickr.com
